0.text:
I want to send my best wishes to
everyone here taking part

4.text:
in pride in London. Especially all those
volunteers who make it possible.

8.text:
Since I recorded last year's message,
there has been one

12.text:
huge historic change in Britain. The
institution of marriage

17.text:
is now open to all. Whether you're a man
and a man;

20.text: a woman and a woman; or woman and a man, your love for one another

25.text:
is equal in the eyes of the law since
the same sex couples Act came into law

31.text:
Couples across the country have been
demonstrating their love

34.text:
and their commitment by tying the knot.
This would not have been possible

38.text: without the support of so many people

40.text:
who are at Pride today. So thank you, you
have made history.

44.text:
I'm immensely proud to be the Prime
Minister in the country.

47.text:
Which is, and this is official, the best
place in Europe to be gay

51.text:
lesbian bisexual or transgender. But that
doesn't mean our job is done.

56.text:
We cannot be complacent. The theme of
this year's Pride

60.text:
is freedom. And I want this to be a country
where

63.text:
all children are free from the fear of
bullying, where elderly people have the

67.text: freedom to be who they are.

69.text:
Where our sportsmen and women have
the freedom to achieve.

72.text:
People like Tom Daley, Claire Harvey,
Nicolas Adams and Casey Stoney

76.text:
who proudly represent this country and
where no one is at risk

80.text:
of the sickening homophobic attacks that
sadly still happen on our streets.

85.text:
And this isn't just about Britain. We are
committed to improving

90.text:
LGBT rights right across the world. I've
raised my concerns about the treatment

96.text:
with President Putin and the Foreign
Office presses the case for positive

101.text:
right around the world. The values of
tolerance

105.text:
freedom and respect: these are the values
that define us

108.text:
in Britain. Not only should we take great
pride in them

111.text:
we should encourage the rest of the
world to take our lead.
